Azure AD connect wizard has the potential to run without fixing anything or getting you any closer to a solution. A diagnosis should proceed any attempt at a basic fix that 'might' resolve the problem.

The issue of "Unhealthy Identity Synchronization Notification" in the subject line of automated emails to the IT team suggests that there is an issue with the identity synchronization between the on-premises Active Directory and the Azure AD environment. To resolve this issue, the first tool that should be run is the Azure AD Connect wizard (B).

The Azure AD Connect wizard is used to configure and manage the synchronization of identities between on-premises Active Directory and Azure AD. It allows you to troubleshoot and fix issues related to identity synchronization, such as the one described in this problem statement. Running the wizard will enable you to identify and resolve any configuration or connectivity issues that may be causing the automated email messages.

After resolving the synchronization issues, other tools such as Synchronization Service Manager (A), Synchronization Rules Editor (C) and IdFix (D) can be used for further management and fine-tuning of the identity synchronization process.
